DPRK and Polish Foreign Ministers Greet Each Other
    Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- The foreign ministers of the DPRK and Poland exchanged messages of greetings on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the two countries.
 Paek Nam Sun noted that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries have favorably developed in the interests of the two peoples for the last 55 years and sincerely wished his Polish counterpart success in his responsible work.    
 Wlodzimierz Cimoszewicz expressed the belief that there are many possibilities and ways of solution for the DPRK and Poland to continue to develop the ties on good terms, after affirmatively appreciating the recent work in the field of mutual relations.

Yang Hyong Sop Meets Vietnamese Delegation
    Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with a delegation of the Vietnamese Foreign Ministry led by its Vice-Minister Le Van Bang at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 On hand were DPRK Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kung Sok Ung and Vietnamese Ambassador to the DPRK Do Thi Hoa.
